knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r loading}
library(tidyverse)

#reading in WS3 well data
ws3_upper_wells <- read_csv("RealTime_Water_Storage/RealTime_Water_Storage/Water_table_WS3upper_WS_3Up_wells.dat",
                 skip = 4, col_names = c(X1 = "TIMESTAMP" , X2 = "RECORD", X3 ="Batt_Volt", X4= "ptemp_Max" , X5= "HB156_psi", X6= "HB156_rawdepth", X7= "HB156_depth_corr", X8= "HB156_corr_depth", X9=  "HB156_welltemp" , X10= "HB179s_psi", X11= "HB179s_rawdepth", X12=  "HB179s_depth_corr" , X13= "HB179s_corr_depth" , X14= "HB179s_welltemp" , X15= "HB176d_psi" , X16= "HB176d_rawdepth", X18= "HB176d_depth_corr" , X19= "HB176d_corr_depth", X20 = "HB176d_welltemp"))


#reading in WS9 well data
ws9_upper_wells <- read_csv("RealTime_Water_Storage/RealTime_Water_Storage/Water_table_WS9_WS_9_wells.dat",
                 skip = 4, col_names = c(X1 = "TIMESTAMP" , X2 = "RECORD", X3 ="Batt_Volt", X4= "ptemp_Max" , X5= "HB156_psi", X6= "HB156_rawdepth", X7= "HB156_depth_corr", X8= "HB156_corr_depth", X9=  "HB156_welltemp" , X10= "HB179s_psi", X11= "HB179s_rawdepth", X12=  "HB179s_depth_corr" , X13= "HB179s_corr_depth" , X14= "HB179s_welltemp" , X15= "HB176d_psi" , X16= "HB176d_rawdepth", X18= "HB176d_depth_corr" , X19= "HB176d_corr_depth", X20 = "HB176d_welltemp"))


```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
